meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Israel.
meanings.sent1: In Israel, you can buy many things with just one shekel.
meanings.sent2: I used a shekel to pay for my coffee at the cafe.
meanings.sent3: Why did the coin go to school? To become a smart shekel!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a shekel in gold.
meanings.sent5: The shiny shekel glinted in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in ancient Israel and the Middle East, equal to about 11.4 grams.
meanings.sent1: The merchant measured the spices using a shekel.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists found ancient artifacts weighing a shekel each.
meanings.sent3: Why did the scale break? It couldn't handle the weight of a heavy shekel!
meanings.sent4: His words carried a shekel of truth, undeniable and solid.
meanings.sent5: The shekel balanced perfectly on the scale, a precise measure of ancient trade.
